formattedAddress: 112 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 112 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: I have been going here since February and am still extremely happy with the service and prices. The staff are very friendly and I am grateful I found this place! If you need a quick shoe shine or new heels, check them out!

text.text: I have been going here since February and am still extremely happy with the service and prices. The staff are very friendly and I am grateful I found this place! If you need a quick shoe shine or new heels, check them out!

originalText.text: It's the Best shoe shiner I have ever had. I even came twice within 10 days. She handled my shoes really well and well shine. It's well recomended !!

text.text: It's the Best shoe shiner I have ever had. I even came twice within 10 days. She handled my shoes really well and well shine. It's well recomended !!

originalText.text: What a great experience, the staff here are friendly and really know their stuff. I chose to get the highest level of shine offered due to my shoes never having any treatment and being in dire need. A dark haired girl helped me, and explained what she was doing during the process. She did an amazing job, my shoes look better than the day I bought them. If you are in the financial district do yourself a favor and go here. Seats are comfortable, the space is nicer than others, reading material available, and talented, professional, friendly staff.

originalText.text: Amazing! I don't know where to start. These guys are seriously good at what they do. I've never had my shoes shined before and they did an amazing job at making feel welcome. Being my first...I decided to make it count. I got the all out saphir shine. These shoes were a little different being two toned. They were a Christmas gift. I felt bad because I already scuffed them up. There was a deep scratch on my right does and tons of marks all over then both. They put coat after coat and fixed them right up. You can't even see the marks anymore. They actually look better than they did when I first opened them.

originalText.text: Don’t make shoes worse. That is your one job. Careless. Ruined shoes with Nubuck detailing by not paying attention. Clear grease/polish should be used with care. There is no reversing their $10 job on $800 boots. Have cheap shoes? Go to town. Buyer beware.
